intro: Cheiloclinium hippocrateoides, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their medicinal properties. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. The plant thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to salty, well-drained soils.
